notes.text:
This update for python-urllib3 fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2023-43804: Fixed a potential cookie leak via HTTP redirect if the user manually set the corresponding header (bsc#1215968).
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.text: urllib3 is a user-friendly HTTP client library for Python. urllib3 doesn't treat the `Cookie` HTTP header special or provide any helpers for managing cookies over HTTP, that is the responsibility of the user. However, it is possible for a user to specify a `Cookie` header and unknowingly leak information via HTTP redirects to a different origin if that user doesn't disable redirects explicitly. This issue has been patched in urllib3 version 1.26.17 or 2.0.5.
notes.title: Vulnerability description
